result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley M Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ashley M Chavez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ashley M Chavez was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Charge #2 added.  Possession of Narcotic Drugs.
and Voter rights form, and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant and Atty Riek

Defendant Ashley M Chavez in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentencing withheld, placed on probation for 3 years.  60 days jail with Huber, consecutive to any other sentence.  Forthwith may transfer to Green Lake County Jail.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  $518.00 costs.  The $164.00 being held by Randolph P.D. is to be applied towards costs.  No jail credit.  Dismiss Count 1.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Green Lake Cty. Jail for 7/8/14 at 2:45
and Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Long
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: with Petition For Leave To File Additional Motions and Motion For Preservation Of Evidence filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Ashley M Chavez by video from Green Lake Cty Jail, with attorney Amanda K Riek in court.  Jane E Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2500.00 signature bond.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 02:50 pm.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 02:45 pm.  Bond was mailed to defendant to be signed.
